title: Man ‘poured beer in alligator’s mouth after trying to get it to bite him’
text:
Tomothy Kepke is charged with unlawfully taking an alligator after allegedly trying to force it to drink beer. (Picture: Facebook/Getty)

A man tried to get an alligator to bite him then poured beer in the animal’s mouth, police say.

Timothy Kepke, 27, and Noah Osborne, 22, were both arrested in Palm City, Florida last week and charged with one count of unlawfully taking an alligator.

The Florida Fish and Wildlife Conservation Commission got a tip in August about Kepke allegedly forcing beer into the reptile’s mouth.

He reportedly enticed the alligator to open it’s jaws by offering up his right forearm as bait.

Authorities said the bizarre stunt was filmed, however the footage has not been released, the TC Palm reported.

Kepke was arrested on October 3 after the Florida Fish and Wildlife Conservation got a tip about his alleged stunt with the alligator (Picture: Martin County Sheriff’s Office)

Noah Osborne, 22, was also arrested and charged with one count of unlawfully taking an alligator. Kepke told authorities that Osborne grabbed the reptile with his bare hands (Picture: Martin County Sheriff’s Office)

Police interviewed Kepke on September 17.

He reportedly told officers that Osborne caught the alligator with his bare hands.

He also admitted that he had few beers himself before he tried to pour one down the alligator’s throat, although he clarified that he was not drunk at the time.

A women who witnessed the incident told police that the alligator reacted aggressively after it was given the beer. She added that she though it bit Kepke because of his behavior.

Afterwards, Kepke told officers that he and Osborne released the alligator alive. Both Osborne and Kepke were arrested on October 3.

They were booked at the Martin County Jail. They were released later that day after paying their bonds, which was $5,000 for Kepke and $2,500 for Osborne.
